page.title: 14Manor Farm
page.content: { Mr and Mrs Groom}have lived on{Manor {Farm}for 28 years and each morning they have to get up at approximately 6:30 a.m. to feed the animals. The Groom's have changed the farm since they lived there in two ways; drained it and ploughed the fields. Altogether there are 58 acres of wheat and 150 acres of grass. The Groom's have two small and six large cattle sheds which altogether hold 200 cows. They have 65 limousin cattle, four bulls, 600 sheep and two sheepdogs. They no longer have a dairy herd. The three months of winter are the busiest time of the year. Only two men work on the farm one is Mr. Groom and the other a farm labourer. Their house is very old; the oldest part is{350 {years old.}Their land covers 208 acres.
